before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"4591j","text":"In this protocol we do not cover how to engineer a bacterium to express fluorescence. We expect the user to have their strains already transformed and characterized for the best expression conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s3kn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ot7g","text":"As an example of the application of this protocol, we are using the plant pathogen Ralstonia solanacearum strain Rs5 transformed with an inducible red fluorescent protein carried in the vector \"pFLxR5\" available through Addgene (plasmid ID 149482). The vector pFLxR5 has the antibiotic marker gentamicin and a LuxR/PLuxB promoter-regulator pair regulating an mRFP cassette 17. Expression of RFP was induced in Ralstonia by N-(3-oxohexanoyl) homoserine lactone (OC6) added to media at a working concentration of 10.2 µM. To prevent loss of plasmid throughout incubation in broth and agar, gentamicin (at a concentration of 10 mg/L (gent-10)) was always included in the media.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":83,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":410,"length":9},{"style":"sub","offset":316,"length":5},{"style":"sup","offset":373,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":310,"length":10}],"data":{}},{"key":"bf6gr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55j49","text":"Transformation of Ralstonia was done as described by Perrier et al. (2018) 18. To ensure plasmid retention, cultures of Ralstonia were grown in the presence of gentamicin at a concentration of 10 mg/L. No selective pressure was applied to soil samples. We profiled the stability of the plasmid in Ralstonia for a duration of three days and did not observe any biological loss of vector. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":18,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":120,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":297,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":75,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ef56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7tt2","text":"This protocol was tested with clay soil with native microflora. Therefore, we are using semi-selective media optimized for Ralstonia and our expression needs. Users will need to optimize media for their own conditions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":123,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ckop","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85qci","text":"This protocol describes in detail how to apply the MPN-RFU microplate assay to enumerate concentrations of Ralstonia solanacearum in soil samples. For other bacterial systems and soil types, users will have to optimize and adapt each step to their own conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":145,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j12i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21fv5","text":"The MPN-RFU microplate assay is not restricted to soil samples. It can be adapted and optimized for other sample types. We recommend users who are interested in learning how to set up and run the assay to go directly to sections \"Setting up a 96-well microplate for serial dilutions\", steps 31-33, \"Recording relative fluorescence units (RFU) before starting incubation (T0)\", \"Replenishing media at 24 h\", and \"Recording RFU measurements at T48\".","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45gps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt1um","text":" To calculate an MPN value from RFU data and microplate formats, users can use our command-line package \"MicroMPN\". A separate protocols.io was created to guide users through the process of running MicroMPN 20.   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":212},{"style":"sup","offset":207,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ug3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2617A8DAEF8C11EDAC0D0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c5is4","text":"Here we provide a step-by-step protocol for running the MPN fluorescence microplate assay with soil samples inoculated with a fluorescently tagged pathogen. We performed the MPN fluorescence assay in 96-well microplates to facilitate automation of fluorescence data collection using a plate reader. Serial dilutions were performed in semi-selective media and in the presence of a homoserine lactone to induce expression of a red fluorescent protein. When the signal is a product of the organism, rather than the medium, it reflects both viability and specificity simultaneously. For brevity, we refer to this method as the MPN-RFU microplate assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4dg8d","text":"The most probable number (MPN) assay is a culture-dependent method of quantification most commonly used to enumerate microbes from environmental samples 1. In the MPN assay, the density of viable microbes is determined by serially diluting to extinction in a culture medium. An MPN count (MPN/mL or MPN/g) is therefore based on the presence or absence of a measurable signal, such as media turbidity 2 and color change 3,4 .The original MPN assay quantifies a population of microbes based on the properties of the growth medium and is specific to microbes that can metabolize the nutrients in the medium (e.g., anaerobes, methanogens, iron reducers) 3,6,7,8.  For greater specificity, the MPN luminescence variation of the assay relies on microbial strains that produce a detectable signal – such as luminescence 9,10 or fluorescence expression 11-14 – that differentiates the target from the rest of the sample. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":153,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":400,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":419,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":650,"length":7},{"style":"sup","offset":813,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":845,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpr27","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r2v0","text":"MPN calculations require two fixed quantities: sample volume and number of replicates at each dilution step; calculations of an MPN value are based on probability theory and not on an absolute count 5.  There are assumptions that must be met in order for the MPN assay to estimate the true microbial concentration in a sample 1,5. Assumption 1, the inoculum contains random distribution of microbial cells. This means that at each dilution step, samples must be thoroughly mixed before proceeding with further dilutions. Clumps prevent proper dilution of the sample leading to abnormal results with increasing dilutions. Assumption 2, the presence of even one microbe within the inoculum volume will yield a measurable signal. \n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":199,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":325,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3inh2","text":"When applying the MPN-RFU microplate assay to environmental samples, selective or semi-selective media must be used in order to reduce background noise. Otherwise, this method will result in false-positives. If applying the assay to pure cultures, then there is no need to use selective media.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v0nj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ac6k","text":"In cases where the user is trying to quantify a low-density population from soil samples, consider filtering or centrifuging samples to remove unwanted soil particles. In our setup, we did not perform these additional steps. Therefore, soil particles fully blocked the passage of the excitation light in undiluted samples (row 1 of microplate). Even though there were soil particulates at 10-1 and 10-2 dilutions, emission spectra were obtained for these wells.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":391,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":400,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oitq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm2na","text":"In this protocol we are using 96-well microplate, but this assay can be performed with other plate formats as long as the plate reader has different plate configurations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t01f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jila","text":"A 48-h incubation of a microplate was enough time to allow our tractable system (Ralstonia solanacearum) to grow in the most diluted wells. Depending on the bacterial strain, microplates may need to be incubated for longer times. In such cases, ensure that media levels are carefully replenished in wells showing sign of volume loss due to evaporation. Alternatively, serial dilutions and incubation can be carried out in a deep-well plate, and, at the time of data collection, samples transferred to a plate that meets the specifications of a plate reader.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":81,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49h73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tgpc","text":"We note that although well volume determines the path length and is correlated linearly to the intensity of fluorescence of each well, small differences in volume generally should not impact the determination of a positive sample. Positive samples in our system are, on average, two orders of magnitude (100x) brighter than background, while the threshold for a positive read was nearly twice the average of background RFU. In theory, a volume reduction of 98% would be required to yield a false negative, on average. Path length correction is available in many microplate readers for study systems in which a higher level of sensitivity is required and volume differences may impact the outcome of the analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d416o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"336j0","text":"MPN calculations require two fixed quantities: sample volume and number of replicates at each dilution step1,5,16. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":107,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jn26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77m6o","text":"From a streak plate, prepare an overnight culture. Pick three independent colonies and inoculate 6 mL of CPG broth supplemented with 10 mg/L of gentamicin. Prepare overnight cultures on the same day as the deepwell plate loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ik6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mdrc","text":"*Depending on the number of soil wells to be inoculated, prepare sufficient volume of bacterial culture. In our experiments, soil wells were inoculated with 150 µL.  Therefore, 6 mL should be enough volume for inoculating approximately 30 - 35 wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":164},{"style":"italic","offset":165,"length":86}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d9ee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd33r","text":"* The number of soil wells to inoculate with bacteria will be determined by how the user choses to distribute soil replicates per a 96-well microplate. Samples must be diluted to extinction in order to estimate the original microbial load in soil; however, there are different ways in which a user could structure sample distribution across a microplate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":151},{"style":"italic","offset":153,"length":201}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qb1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd4vs","text":"*Whether a microplate needs to shake or not will also affect how many wells of soil can be processed at a time. In our experimental design, to speed up bacterial growth and promote synthesis of fluorescent protein, we maintained microplates under shaking conditions. For this step we used a digital microplate shaker which fits 4 plates at a time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":348}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34eie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o2aa","text":"*We used 10-fold serial dilutions, but users can use other dilution series.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":74}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fir4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1gci","text":"For example:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"806d8","text":"In our case, from a single soil well we aliquoted 8 replicates of soil to column 1 of a microplate and performed eleven 10-fold serial dilutions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg5o4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"84ig3","text":"In the above layout, users might process 2 soil samples per plate, for 4 replicates per sample. steps.section: Setting up a 96 well microplate for serial dilutions

Once resuspended, store stock at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":169,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a54bq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"23FB21E0F21111ED8D85A16790DD7A83","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Setting up a 96 well microplate for serial dilutions

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"adfoh","text":"Resuspend the soil samples by manually shaking for 2 min. The excitation wavelength was 571 nm, with emissions collected at 620 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Recording relative fluorescence units (RFU) before starting incubation (T0)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"as2j7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gmm4","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E9D90D50F35111ED8D85A16790DD7A83","height":132,"id":393427,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"k9bg\",\"text\":\"Example of T0 RFU readings.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Undiluted_T0_sample_A1.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagxb42rp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagvb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagwb42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagub42rp.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Recording relative fluorescence units (RFU) before starting incubation (T0)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1usu","text":"Using RFU data from T0, calculate RFU threshold above which wells will be considered positive for the presence of Ralstonia. Calculate an average (avg) RFU value for columns* 3-12. Then calculate the standard deviation (sd) for the same set of wells. RFU threshold = avg + (5 * sd).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":114,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mdlr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmhgo","text":"* These columns were chosen because the values of column 3 were not different from subsequent columns, indicating that sample dilution was sufficient to reach the limit of sensitivity for the instrument. Thus, variation between wells in these columns represents the level of background noise for the instrument on these samples. The threshold for a positive sample is then set to 5-sigma above this noise level.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":411}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Recording relative fluorescence units (RFU) before starting incubation (T0)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4h3hd","text":"Cover the plate with a clean lid and incubate the microplate at   under shaking conditions (900 rpm). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1493t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ll9v","text":"* Although the lids should already be clean, as a final measure of sterility, wipe lids with 70% ethanol. Allow ethanol to evaporate before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":144}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emvla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"30866670F34911ED8D85A16790DD7A83","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ge91","text":"Carefully stop the plate shaker and remove the lid. Take RFU measurements using the SpectraMax plate adapter. Although we did not use this RFU data to calculate an MPN value, it enabled us to confirm that the experiment was working and track which wells required further incubation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t75b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sifa","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BEC44DF0F35111ED8D85A16790DD7A83","height":130,"id":393431,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"b06gl\",\"text\":\"Example of T24 RFU readings. Highlighted in green are wells positive for rfp-tagged Ralstonia. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":84,\"length\":9}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Undiluted_T24_sample_A1_B1.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag3b42rp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagzb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag2b42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nagyb42rp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31drk","text":"Replenish wells with dilutions 10^-2 to 10^-11 using the leftover media prepared earlier. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"agvf7","text":"Transfer media to a sterile reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3mi4","text":"Replenish wells with media starting from the most diluted samples. We recommend changing tips in between dilution steps to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9quu","text":"Carefully stop the plate shaker and remove the lid. Take RFU measurements using the SpectraMax plate adapter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98frn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b69nn","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7t5or","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7DA2A250F35A11ED8D85A16790DD7A83","height":135,"id":393435,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"tap7\",\"text\":\"Example of T48 RFU readings. Highlighted in green are wells positive for rfp-tagged Ralstonia.  Since the MPN assay is based on the principle of dilution to extinction, columns 1 and 2 are also considered positive.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":84,\"length\":9}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"78esf\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"9a5vm\",\"text\":\"This microplate data in this example yields an MPN estimate for a single well of soil.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Undiluted_T48_sample_A1_B1.PNG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag7b42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag5b42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag6b42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag4b42rp.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Setting up a 96 well microplate for serial dilutions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5kq20","text":"While soil microcosms are being incubated, begin media and supplement preparations for serial dilutions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45djg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24uaj","text":"In our study system, a single microplate was used per well of soil.  Each microplate has 8 replicates with 11 dilutions, across a total of 88 microwells. If 90 μL of media is added to each of these microwells, then (on average) 1 microplate requires ~ 7.92 mL of media. We prepared an excess (~ 10 mL) of media per plate, and used the extra volume to replenish media lost to evaporation at 24 hrs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rh0l","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0765BF50FBE311ED941105E15A1665C7","height":278,"id":393439,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"10 fold serial dilutions.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahbb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag9b42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahab42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nag8b42rp.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Determining the average grams of soil per well
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cc0d7","text":"Soil wells from the deepwell plate that were not used for inoculation are instead used to estimate the average amount of soil in each well. The average mass of soil per plate will be used to normalize the estimated MPN value to obtain an MPN/g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78thb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0629","text":" For this part, cut off a portion of a silicone mat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a61rk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqglc","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8f1d5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"186A4AF0FBF211ED941105E15A1665C7","height":206.30727272727273,"id":393443,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"silicone_mat_cut.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahfb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahdb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/naheb42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahcb42rp.webp","width":297.81889763779526}}}}

steps.section: Determining the average grams of soil per well
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gia2","text":"Use the uncut portion of the silicone mat to seal off the wells containing liquid and use the smaller pieces of silicone for wells that have dry soil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9099c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A354E260FBF211ED941105E15A1665C7","height":226.00000000000003,"id":393447,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"plate_soil_weigh.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahjb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahhb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahib42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahgb42rp.webp","width":301.69902912621353}}}}

steps.section: Determining the average grams of soil per well
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ulhe","text":"Once all wells are covered, weigh the soil from the selected unsused wells. Place a piece of paper on the balance and tare it. Then, invert the deepwell plate and decant the soil onto the paper. We usually weighed between 5 and 8 wells of soil per experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

8” x 10 ¾” polypropylene trays and their snap-on lids (Bel-Art F1630-0000)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er3aj","text":"Ceramic trowel","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b489g","text":"Paintbrush","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o561","text":"Rubber steps below for specific sterilization and cleaning protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":66}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ca93t","text":"Gather items 1-9 and follow the sub-steps below to clean and sterilize them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"16h7a","text":"Wash with Alconox.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2uudq","text":"Rinse with hot tap water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"efrgv","text":"Rinse with deionized water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"t5om","text":"Dry with brown paper towels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1r1u4","text":"Wrap each item individually with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fca3p","text":"Sterilize with an autoclave cycle of 30 minutes at 121°C and a dry cycle of 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bosgj","text":"Follow the sub-steps below to clean, sanitize, and air dry the Greiner Bio-One 96-well, polystyrene, flat-bottom, clear microplate (item 655101) and its lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4pos0","text":"Wash with Alconox.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"70p2t","text":"Rinse with hot tap water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fk82h","text":"Rinse with deionized water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6fbu3","text":"Spray with 70% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avqb6","text":"Air dry in a biosafety cabinet, with the inner sides of the plate and lid facing down.  To allow for air flow underneath, prop one against the other in an A-shape.  If there are many to dry, stack them in a circle like fallen dominos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m1l0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"11021CF0F5AA11ED8BE74B6D454098A6","height":228.99999999999994,"id":393451,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"b2cvm\",\"text\":\"Fig. 1. How to stack microplates and lids, facing downward, in an A or circular, fallen-dominos configuration to allow air flow for drying in a biosafety cabinet.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_E3343[1].JPG","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahpb42rx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahmb42rx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahnb42rx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahkb42rx.webp","width":351.8156424581005}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qulr","text":"After all items previously listed in this section have dried (usually overnight), follow the sub-steps below to dry soil. Soil will be dried in a sterile polypropylene container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efqb4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61kkg","text":"Wear PPE when performing the following sub-steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b0o76","text":"Wipe down benches and hard work surfaces with 70% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1cq0","text":"Using a sterile trowel, mix the soil in the storage bucket. Once mixed, transfer soil to the pre-labeled polypropylene tray. Usually, one to two scoops are sufficient to load several deepwell plates. On average, each well receives 0.4 grams of soil. For example, 0.4 g x 96 wells = 38.4 grams of soil needed per plate. This should give users an idea of how much soil they will need depending on their experimental design.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8atg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qvr5","text":"It is good practice to record how much soil was used for each experiment. This can serve as reference for future scaling of experiments. Without the lid, tare and weigh soil in tray using a regular balance. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3ma7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fvh9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"enuoq","text":"Place a label on the lidded polypropylene tray. On this label, write the starting date and time of soil drying. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53v82","text":"Once the soil has dried for 6 days, load it into a 96-deepwell plate by following the sub-steps below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3r3r9","text":"Before drying the soil, cover the tray with brown paper towels and affix with tape. The paper towels provide a breathable membrane that will allow water to evaporate. Place the covered tray where it is not under lights and not humid. Allow the soil to dry at  , for 6 days or  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":259,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":276,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"880416AAFB2611EDB7EC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":518400,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"88041778FB2611EDB7EC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l6n0","text":"Start by removing the paper towels covering the tray, then weigh the tray and record changes in soil mass. Users will note a drop in weight. Drier soil makes it easier to load deepwell plates using the technique shown in the video.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am4ks","text":"By the flame, use a sterile 50-mL conical-bottom centrifuge tube to transfer soil into a sterile, aluminum foil-lined mortar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"evtp7","text":"Pulverize the dried soil with the pestle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bi425","text":"Sift the pulverized soil with the sterile strainer into a new sterile polypropylene tray.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bgj0","text":"Place large particles remaining in the strainer back with the rest of the un-processed soil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a51qe","text":"Use the conical tube to transfer the strained, pulverized soil into the Greiner microplate. The microplate wells will function as measuring cups.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fi2c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jl4h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"63246A00FBFA11ED941105E15A1665C7","height":233.25454545454545,"id":393455,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"adding_soil_to_greiner.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahtb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahrb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahsb42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahqb42rp.webp","width":312.9024390243902}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9es8c","text":"Use a spatula and gloved hand to level the soil flush with the top of the microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jm6e","text":"Overlay the sterile pipette tip rack on top of the filled microplate. The rack will function as a funnel.  Align the rack holes with the microplate wells to ensure the transfer of soil from the microplate to a deepwell plate.  Use two rubber bands to hold the assembly together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sbfv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ada8d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CFFC07F0FBFA11ED941105E15A1665C7","height":350.5054545454546,"id":393459,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"overlay_tips_greiner.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahxb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahvb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahwb42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahub42rp.webp","width":311.9385113268609}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a57jo","text":"Now, overlay the tip rack with a sterile deepwell plate. Be careful to avoid lateral movement. The bottom portion of the assembly must maintain alignment in order to funnel soil into the deepwell plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7bvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aod8h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5B246BB0FBFB11ED941105E15A1665C7","height":321.58181818181816,"id":393463,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"greiner_tip_deepwell.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah3b42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahzb42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah2b42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nahyb42rp.webp","width":341.44787644787647}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dldf","text":"Invert the entire assembly to load the deepwell plate with soil. Pat the microplate if clumps of soil do not release. Then, carefully remove the tip rack and the empty microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67pl1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a74lg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"876AF450FBFB11ED941105E15A1665C7","height":231.22363636363642,"id":393467,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"plate_rotation.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah7b42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah5b42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah6b42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah4b42rp.webp","width":360.2634560906516}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"db6sq","text":"Brush away excess soil from the skirt of the deepwell plate with the paintbrush.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rdp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0609","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A05B8970FBFB11ED941105E15A1665C7","height":232,"id":393471,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"cleaning soil excess.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/naibb42rp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah9b42rp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/naiab42rp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nah8b42rp.webp","width":232}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d185m","text":"As required by experiments executed on the same day, repeat the above sub-steps to load additional deepwell plates with dried soil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dap0a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5072u","text":"On the outside of a deepwell plate, label the date and experiment name.  If there are multiple plates, write a description to distinguish between plate treatments.  As a precaution, label both sides of the plates with the same information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1on77","text":"In this section, we cover how to assemble high-throughput soil microcosms. Play the video below to overview how to load a 96-deepwell plate with soil in about 4 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f0hc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emko1","text":"Note: The MPN-RFU microplate assay is not restricted to soil samples. It can be adapted and optimized for other sample types. We recommend users who are interested in learning how to set up and run the assay go directly to the following sections:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n6v3","text":"\"Setting up a 96-well microplate for serial dilutions\", ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nkr4","text":"steps 31-33, ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pmfm","text":"\"Recording relative fluorescence units (RFU) before starting incubation (T0)\", ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tmuq","text":"\"Replenishing media at 24 h\", and ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aith6","text":"\"Recording RFU measurements at T48\".","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32bb0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65cob","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ia26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o5o2","text":"In our system, we used clay soil which was retrieved in 2021 from the University of Florida, North Florida Research and Education Center (Quincy, Florida, USA). Soil was collected from four sections of a plot (30.551302, -84.599687) at a depth of 15 cm and combined as one. Soil was stored in air-tight, polyethylene containers at 4°C for 1 year. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ltsm","text":"Before use, we dried soil at room temperature in a sterile tray for 6 days. At the end of day 6 of drying we loaded 2-mL deepwell plates, the individual wells of which we refer to as soil microcosms. Plates were covered with a sterile lid and left on a bench at room temperature. In the early morning of the following day, we inoculated soil wells with rfp-tagged Ralstonia. Inoculated systems were incubated in the dark at    (± 2°C) and   (± 5%) relative humidity, for a total of 3 days or  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":364,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":425,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":439,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":492,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cgvej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cceb","text":"In the remainder of this section, we describe step-by-step how to assemble high-throughput soil microcosms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CF636250057A11EEB4E3D51BD42421B4","height":0,"id":379235,"is_video":true,"legend":"","mime":"video/mp4","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"SAM_3633 Loading soil into 96-deepwell plate.MP4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mum2b42rx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mumdb42rx.mp4","width":0}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E5B01800019211EE8DD061C952993721","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"humidity","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","guid":"1D4CB250019311EE8DD061C952993721","id":0}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":259200,"guid":"EBF073C0033811EE9B4FB9364500BBBA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"debm2","text":"Repeat sub-steps 6.2 - 6.5 until enough soil has been pulverized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8goim","text":"A loaded deepwell plate with soil is used the next day. Users must time the drying of soil with the steps described in this new section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":80}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36lhi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tpoa","text":"In our experiments, we used the bacterium Ralstonia solanacearum strain Rs5 to inoculate soil. We made R. solanacearum tractable by transforming the bacterium with the plasmid pFLxR5 (Addgene plasmid ID 149482). This plasmid encodes for a red fluorescent protein, whose expression in controlled by the LuxR/PLuxB promoter-regulator pair. The transcriptional regulator LuxR binds to inducer N-(3-oxohexanoyl) homoserine lactone (OC6), which then recruits the RNA polymerase to the promoter LuxB to initialize transcription of mRFP. Additionally, the plasmid encodes for a gentamicin resistance cassette. The antibiotic gentamicin was always included in the media (broth and agar), to prevent loss of plasmid throughout incubation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":42,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":103,"length":15},{"style":"sub","offset":308,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68rdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vjmr","text":"In this next section, users will inoculate the soil-loaded deepwell plate with the overnight culture of Ralstonia prepared in the above section. Before soil inoculation we remove the antibiotic gentamicin by centrifuging and resuspending the overnight culture in a dilute sodium chloride solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":104,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jjtt","text":"A 48-h incubation of a microplate was enough time to allow Ralstonia solanacearum to grow in the most diluted wells. However, to ensure that enough media remained in wells to continue the incubation process, we had to replenish the evaporated media with fresh broth. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56tqi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lpgj","text":"*We note that although well volume determines the path length and is correlated linearly to the intensity of fluorescence of each well, small differences in volume generally should not impact the determination of a positive sample. Positive samples in our system are - on average - two orders of magnitude (100x) brighter than background, while the threshold for a positive read was nearly twice the average of background RFU. In theory, a volume reduction of 98% would be required to yield a false negative, on average. Path length correction is available in many microplate readers for study systems where a higher level of sensitivity is required, and volume differences may impact the outcome of the analysis.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":713}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ab9r","text":"Cover the microplate with a clean lid and continue incubation for the remaining 24 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1h10a","text":"Export RFU data for MPN calculations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1p4pk","text":"It is recommended to wear gloves, closed-toe shoes, goggles, and a mask to avoid abrasion and particulate inhalation of soil. Other personal protective equipment (PPE) may be required based on the biosafety level of the microbes in a particular soil sample and consortia. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ed6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cfln","text":"Wear PPE when preparing antibiotic solutions, preparing semi-selective media, and while handling microplates with media.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ggf9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"balis","text":"Handle with care the antibiotic cyclohexamide, as it inhibits protein synthesis in eukaryotic systems.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qa1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arp5g","text":"It is the responsibility of each user to carefully read the MSDS of each reagent used in this protocol and adhere to their recommendations in the proper handling, storage, and disposal. Users can also consult with their institution Environmental Health and Safety department for further assistance.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ducgj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
